qas.question: South Africa used what type of system to determine it's high courts until 2013?
When was the Supreme Court of Appeal created?
What court in South Africa has authority over the SCA?
When did the Constitutional Court become the highest court in South Africa in all matters?
What was created in 2013 to replace the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of South Africa?
What is the Constitutional Court subordinate to?

context: In South Africa, <b4_0>a <a0_0>"two apex"<a0_0/> system<b4_0/> existed from 1994 to 2013. <b5_0>The Supreme Court of Appeal (SCA)<b5_0/> was created in <a1_0>1994<a1_0/> and replaced the Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of South Africa as the highest court of appeal in non-constitutional matters. <b7_0>The SCA<b7_0/> is subordinate to <a2_0>the Constitutional Court<a2_0/>, which is the highest court in matters involving the interpretation and application of the Constitution. But in <a3_0>August 2013<a3_0/> <b6_0>the Constitution<b6_0/> was amended to make the Constitutional Court the country's single apex court, superior to the SCA in all matters, both constitutional and non-constitutional.
